Action: Traveler identifies business need and discusses travel opportunity with their Supervisor.

With Supervisor's support, Traveler secures necessary travel approval.

  • Domestic: CAO or A/D
  • Overseas: CAO approval first, then Region approval (email from ChOPs/ChIPs), and finally A/D approval

Traveler obtains quote and itinerary from Peace Corps' travel agent, SATO, by emailing SATO@peacecorps.gov the following information:

  1. Legal name as written on ID card
  2. Proceed date with origin and destination cities
  3. Return date with origin and destination cities.
  4. Domestic lodging requirements, such as hotel name, number of nights, etc. Overseas lodging must be secured directly with the hotel.
Airbnb reservations

Traveler prepares Travel Authorization form and Travel Justification memo and submits to EA Admin.

  1. PC-840 Travel Authorization
    • Ex. Travel Authorization
  2. Travel Justification memo
For approved paid time-off, follow these instructions: Cost construct for indirect travel.

EA Admin reviews Travel Authorization and Travel Justification memo for accuracy and submits to CAO for financial approval. EA Admin then submits to Chief of Staff for programmatic approval. COS approves/denies travel request and returns to EA Admin. EA Admin then submits final documents to Transportation for ticketing.

Est. timeframe: 3 business days.

Transportation records, authorizes, and obligates the travel. A copy of the final TA will be emailed to the Traveler and saved on the shared drive (S://@Agency_All/Travel Documents/)

Transportation instructs SATO to purchase transportation and lodging.

SATO emails final itinerary to Traveler. The email subject will be 'E-TICKET RECEIPT'. This email confirms that your transportation and/or hotel has been purchased. If you have not received this email, your tickets have not been purchased.

Travelers MUST confirm itinerary prior to travel by checking in directly with the airline/hotel via their website.
